ovdesc.p: The AC.CP.GROUP.PARAM defines the basic details of a group. A group is a collection of Accounts that are linked for Cash Pooling purposes. The Accounts need to be of the same Currency but can be owned by different customers.
The group concept has a main Account and is usually a pyramid type structure where lower level accounts feed funds to/from higher level accounts until the main Account rules are run.

desc.p: This field holds the default charge/commission code for the group. Charge is collected for each sweep that falls under the group. Field accepts input of valid record ID of FT.CHARGE.TYPE / FT.COMMISSION.TYPE. This value is defaulted to AC.CASH.POOL record created under the group.

When an account has been set up via cash pooling to debit or credit two other accounts on the same processing date then only one update can take place. When calculating the amount that needs to be transferred to/from an Account the Cash Pool rules can use one of three possible values as the Account balance.
1. ONLINE CLEARED
The balance will be based on the Account cleared balance. This balance will not include any uncleared items (for example cheques deposited with a future exposure date).
2. ONLINE ACTUAL
The balance will be based on the Account uncleared balance. This balance will include uncleared items (for example cheques deposited with a future exposure date).
3. WORKING

This is the 'worst case' scenario balance as it will be impacted by unauthorised debits and would show a lower balance than the actual balance if there were entries due to be passed to this account. This balance type is more critical for on-line sweeps since during the eod any unauthorised items are placed on hold and the working balance adjusted accordingly.
4.VALUE.DATED
This balance reflects the current balance after excluding any forward dated FT, Teller or DC entries. If back value dated adjustment is required then the balance to use can be only Value.dated.
5. USER DEFINED

To arrive Account balance for sweeping purpose based on Bank's requirement instead of any of the above Balance to use option, it can be defined as USER.DEFINED and a valid "S" type of routine from PGM.FILE can be specified in BALANCE.ROUTINE. The balance as arrived by this routine will be used and checked against the Condition as defined in AC.CASH.POOL. To invoke user defined Balances, the rule should have NULL value in BALANCE.TO.USE for the corresponding record in AC.SWEEP.TYPE.
6.WORKING LESS LOCKED AMT
This option will bring the balance of Working balance less of Locked amount in the account record.
The user must enter one of the ABOVE possible values, there is no default.
Values allowed are ONLINE CLEARED, ONLINE ACTUAL, VALUE.DATED ,WORKING LESS LOCKED AMT or WORKING or USER DEFINED.
When using SHARED.BALANCES,BALANCES.TO.USE must be WORKING.
When BACK.VALUE.ADJ is set to YES, BALANCE.TO.USE must be VALUE.DATED

A no input , system updated field showing the main master account balance as specified in the BALANCE.TO.USE field . The balance is the balance of the main master after either last cash pool sweep , whether it occurred on line or during the end of day.
Specify whether the balances in the Cash pool accounts are to be grouped or not.

If SHARED.BALANCES is set as YES, then all the accounts in Cash Pool link will be updated with the cash pool group id in SB.GROUP.ID field in their respective Account and their total available balances will be considered in case of Overdraft during the Maintenance sweep. The balance to use in this case can only be WORKING.
When SHARED.BALANCES is "PARTIAL" balances will be grouped and BALANCE.TO.USE can be other than Working balance.
Above two cases system creates a record in AC.SHARED.ACCOUNT with ID as Group id and with all accounts involved in the group.
Option "NO" can be given when the Balances in Cash pool accounts not to be grouped.
Valid Values Yes or No or Partial
SHARED.BALANCES is Yes, then Balance.to.Use should be "Working"

Must be either AUTO or MANUAL .

Setting this flag to YES, will allow back value dated adjustment entries to be passed, if any back value dated transaction is done to the cash pool account, which would affect the sweeps already done to that account.
Valid values YES or Null
If this field is set to YES, then BALANCE.TO.USE must be VALUE.DATED and field BACK.VALUE.CAP will default to setting of 31 - which can be amended if required.
The number of days up to which back value dated transaction can be processed, this is applicable for all Cash pool links using this Group id.
The start date for back value process is arrived from the latest among the following:

LAST.MAINTENANCE.DATE, which is available in AC.CASH.POOL Cap Back value date arrived using BACK.VALUE.CAP from AC.CP.GROUP.PARAM and Actual oldest back value dated transaction entered for the ACCOUNT.
For example
Cash pool record got created on 05-12-2005
Then start date for back value adjustment start from the latest of the above i.e. 05-12-2005
Defaults to 31 if the previous field, BACK.VALUE.ADJ is set to YES otherwise not allowed.
2 digit Numeric field determined in units of days.
Defaulted values can be changed - But must be between 1 to 31.
If a user defined balance is required for sweeping purposes, specify a routine here which will supply the Account balance.

An "S" type PGM.FILE of the same name as specified here must exist. Instead of using the standard account balances, the balance to be used is supplied by the routine will be considered and checked against the Rule as defined in AC.CASH.POOL.
The routine should be called with 2 parameters, namely the cash pool id (In-Parameter) and the resultant Current Balance (Out-Parameter)
Input allowed only when BALANCE.TO.USE is USER.DEFINED
Should be a valid "S" type of record in PGM.FILE
